questions.text: I can clearly see the steps needed to move a group toward a goal.
I enjoy spending time with people who are hurting so I can encourage and comfort them.
I often find effective ways to explain complex truths in a simple manner.
I feel strongly compelled to start new projects or ministries to meet needs.
I am willing to trust God for what seems impossible and encourage others to do the same.
I naturally notice the needs of visitors and make them feel welcome.
I sometimes sense when a spiritual message or action is not from God.
I feel excited when I can encourage others to keep moving forward in their faith.
I enjoy finding practical ways to organize people and resources for a task.
I am quick to share the Gospel with others, even strangers.
I enjoy caring for the spiritual growth of others over time.
I often provide resources to meet needs before being asked.
I look for ways to communicate biblical truth in everyday conversations.
I can sense when someone's motives may be harmful to the church.
I get energy from helping organize events or ministry activities.
I enjoy supporting others by taking care of practical details.
I am eager to travel or go where needed to share God's message.
I believe God can work through me to bring healing or breakthrough in tough situations.
I love encouraging people when they are discouraged or losing hope.
I am drawn to share my faith with people from different backgrounds.
I feel fulfilled when guiding someone through a challenging life decision.
I feel a responsibility to pray regularly for others' needs.
I enjoy organizing systems that make ministry run more smoothly.
I have a strong desire to nurture and guide new believers.
I am often the first to volunteer to help behind the scenes.
I sense God prompting me to speak truth, even if it's unpopular.
I like creating or leading programs that help people grow spiritually.
I get excited about finding new ways to reach people for Christ.
I look for opportunities to invest financially in Kingdom work.
I enjoy seeing people experience emotional or spiritual healing through care.
I find joy in connecting people to serve together toward a goal.
I have an ability to see how biblical truths apply to today's challenges.
I like to equip and send others into ministry or missions.
I often recognize when spiritual danger is present before others do.
I enjoy providing ongoing encouragement to help others mature in faith.
I can patiently walk with someone as they grow in their walk with God.
I love helping newcomers feel at home in the church.
I trust God will provide even when resources seem impossible to find.
I naturally look for ways to share biblical truth in different formats (teaching, writing, mentoring).
I am drawn to be part of efforts that plant or grow new ministries.
I notice when people's practical needs are not being met.
I can organize teams effectively to accomplish ministry goals.
I feel joy when I see someone grow because of the time I invested in them.
I use my resources to help ministries succeed without needing recognition.
I feel burdened to pray for situations until I see God move.
I enjoy creating lesson plans or outlines that help others understand God's Word.
I sense when someone is speaking from God's Spirit versus their own opinion.
I get energized by meeting new people and starting conversations about faith.
I love speaking or writing words that lift people up.
I am motivated to help in practical ways when I see a need.
I can help people see the bigger picture in difficult situations.
I'm willing to go into challenging or unfamiliar environments for ministry.
I regularly think about how to make ministry more effective and organized.
I often respond to the needs of others with compassion and empathy.
I have an ability to teach others in a way that leads to life change.
I can identify spiritual issues that need to be addressed for health in the church.
I enjoy making visitors and guests feel personally cared for.
I get joy from supporting missions and outreach financially.
I see patterns or truths in Scripture that others often overlook.
I find ways to bring people together to accomplish something meaningful.
